Class Drawable

Any objects that are drawn to the screen should derive from this.

Inheritance

| Improve this Doc View Source

SpriteBatchOptions

The options that'll be used on SpriteBatch.Begin(); for this particular drawable. If left null, it'll use the default parameters and won't create a new SpriteBatch.

This should only be set if you want extra functionality such as shaders or different blend states for example.

Declaration
public SpriteBatchOptions SpriteBatchOptions { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
SpriteBatchOptions
| Improve this Doc View Source

| Improve this Doc View Source

UsePreviousSpriteBatchOptions

If set, it'll ignore calling SpriteBatch.End(); and creating a new SpriteBatch This comes in handy if you want to have multiple sprites under the same SpriteBatch.

This should normally only be set for actual drawable objects and non-containers; things that actually get drawn to the SpriteBatch.

Declaration
public bool UsePreviousSpriteBatchOptions { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean
| Improve this Doc View Source

Destroys the object. Removes the parent object. Any derivates should free any resources used by the object.

Dispose()

Any derivatives should implement this disposition methods and then call this base method to signify that it actually has been disposed of.

RecalculateRectangles()

Recalculates the local and global rectangles of the object. Makes sure that the position and sizes are relative to the parent if the drawable has one.
